timeline.bodyText:
The input networkConfig could come from any other microservice, e.g., Subnet mgr when we start enabling the subnet-level programming path.
So let us keep the method name generic, like validateInput.
timeline.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText:
rsType and opType are DPM internal variable so are supposed to be NULL.
I know it is confusing here. We would need to keep "internal" variable internal to DPM, for example, create an DPM-internal entity class named "InternalNetworkConfiguration" which is a child class of NetworkConfiguration, and place the internal class inside DPM service, not under /web.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Make sense, I won't validate rsType and opType in validation method
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

replies.bodyText: Or check if their value are null
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

replies.bodyText: Let us keep the validation (to make sure it is NULL) until we get rid of the field and then remove the validation.
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText:
Check string null or empty is quite common.
Pls take a look at https://www.baeldung.com/java-blank-empty-strings.
Option 3.1 or 6 looks good to me.
timeline.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Can we enrich the exception by including extra information, like subnet id in this case?

timeline.bodyText:
Become we have a variety of validations, each one field in networkConfig.
Recommend to use a similar way to com.futurewei.alcor.portmanager.util.checkPort by packing one field validation in a single method.
